intro: Steinmannia aurea, commonly known as the golden starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It features showy yellow flowers with a distinctive star-shaped pattern, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and compact growth habit.
